Package com.payd.shooti.math

Class LerpValue<T>

java.lang.Object
com.payd.shooti.math.LerpValue<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
LerpColor, LerpFloat, LerpVector2
public abstract class LerpValue<T> extends Object
LerpValue is a utility class for linear interpolation of numerical values.

Lerp time (speed) is a value greater than 0, less than or equal to 1, where a lower number is a slower lerp.

Consider the speed parameter a multiplier of the divisor applied when calculating the difference between the target and the current, which is applied to the translation.

If no speed is provided in the constructor, the default value of 0.25f will be applied to interpolations which don't have a speed defined. (2016-08-23) LerpValue supports Interpolation parameter in constructor or lerp invocation.
Since:
1.0-24 (2024-05-26) Abstracted interpolation pattern support.
See Also:
  • ULerp

    • set

      public void set(T value, boolean reflectTarget)
      Set the current value with the option to also apply the new value to the target. When reflectTarget is false, the value will be hard set, but the target will stay the same, meaning the current value will eventually return to the target value.
